items.headline: ‘I don’t come from money’: I received $1.2 million after a family tragedy. Am I foolish to keep it in a money-market account?
items.summary_en: “Having a large sum just sitting there freaks me out.”

items.headline: I inherited a $30K trust. My bank says I’ll pay $10K in taxes if I cash out. Something is not right.

items.headline: ‘I don’t wish to be petty’: My mom, 94, is leaving her $1 million estate to me, my brother and his daughter. Is that fair?
items.summary_en: “My share of the home alone would be valued at $300K per the trust. If she distributes the funds three ways, my share becomes $200K.”

items.headline: Credit bureau shares are getting hammered as FICO takes step to directly license mortgage scores
items.summary_en: Shares of TransUnion, Equifax and Experian slumped on Thursday as FICO said it’s going to license its scores used to assess a mortgage borrower’s credit worthiness directly.

items.headline: Energy is the best play, and the market’s biggest risk, for the fourth quarter, says this research firm
items.summary_en: Energy prices are abnormally low and supportive of equity markets everywhere. If they were to spike, however, this would represent the biggest risk to the current investment environment.
